Helper Scripts¶

These scripts assist in the generation of pages or recurring GUI components, as well as facilitate common background processes.

QT_Helpers.py¶

This file contains helper functions and classes that facilitate creation of GUI components and background processes

class QT_Helpers.DelayAction(duration, *funcs, timer=None)¶

This class is a generic thread for delaying the execution of an arbitrary quantity of functions

__init__(duration, *funcs, timer=None)¶

This function initializes the delay thread

Parameters

  • duration – duration in seconds until the callback functions are run

  • funcs –

    callback functions to be run at the end of the duration formatted:[function,parameter]

    Note: To call functions that do not take parameters, None may be used: [function,None]

  • timer – Label element to update with the countdown time

run()¶

This function runs the timer loop that checks for when the delay duration is over, updating the timer each second

terminate()¶

This function stops the delay thread

QT_Helpers.makeButton(self, x, y, w, h, fontsize, name, text)¶

This function condenses the process of creating buttons

Parameters

  • Self – parent window or object

  • x – Top left x position of the button

  • y – Top left y position of the button

  • w – Width of the button

  • h – Height of the button

  • fontsize – Fontsize of the button

  • name – Object name of the button object

  • text – Text Content of the button

Returns

Created button object

QT_Helpers.makeTabLabel(self, x, y, w, h, grayscale, fontSize, name, text)¶

This function condenses the process of creating tab labels

Parameters

  • self – parent window or object

  • x – Top left x position of the tab label

  • y – Top left y position of the tab label

  • w – Width of the tab label

  • h – Height of the tab label

  • grayscale – Singular rgb value (0-255) representative of the greyscale rbg(x,x,x)

  • FontSize – Font size of the tab label

  • name – Object name of the tab label

  • text – Text content of the tab label

Returns

Created tab label object

StateClass.py¶

This file defines the states available to the Wheelchir

class StateClass.State(value)¶

This class contains enumerations representing each of the wheelchair states

::

CHARGER_AVAILABLE = 1 CHARGING_ALLOWED = 3 AWAITING_CONNECTION= 5 READY_TO_CHARGE = 6 CHARGING_IN_PROGRESS = 7 CHARGER_FAULTY_PLUGGED = 8 CHARGER_FAULTY_UNPLUGGED = 12 WC_FULLY_CHARGED = 9 BATTERY_FAULTY = 10 TERMINATED_BY_USER = 11

TimerThread.py¶

This file is responsible for maintaining the clock for the charger

class TimerThread.Clock(lcdObjs)¶

This is the class for the timer/clock

__init__(lcdObjs)¶

This function initializes the clock

Parameters

lcdObjs – array of lcd objects to update with the time format

getTime()¶

This function will return the current time

run()¶

This function will run the clock thread

stop()¶

This function stops the clock thread
